facts: In the Bible, a miracle is an event where God’s power is shown in a way that goes beyond normal human ability.
One famous miracle is when Moses led the Israelites and the Red Sea parted so they could escape from Egypt.
The prophet Elijah is said to have raised a widow’s son back to life, showing that God could restore life.
In the New Testament, Jesus healed many sick people, including those who were blind, unable to walk, or had skin diseases.
The Bible records Jesus feeding a huge crowd with five loaves of bread and two fish, teaching about God’s care and sharing.
Jesus calming a storm on the Sea of Galilee is a miracle that helped his followers trust him during frightening times.
The Book of Acts describes miracles done by Jesus’ followers, such as healing a man who could not walk, to spread their message.
sources_hint: Look in Exodus 14, 1 Kings 17, the Gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, John), and Acts for these miracle stories.
